statuses.label: Backlog
statuses.description: Game stories identified but not yet refined. Requirements may be incomplete or need design work.

statuses.label: Ready for Dev
statuses.description: Game stories with complete design specs, ready for implementation. All mechanics are defined.

statuses.label: In Progress
statuses.description: Currently being implemented. Developer is actively working on the game feature.

statuses.label: Review
statuses.description: Implementation complete, awaiting playtest and code review before merging.

statuses.label: Human Review
statuses.description: Awaiting human review and approval. Complete all checklist items before moving to Done.

statuses.label: Done
statuses.description: Implemented, tested, and verified. The game feature is complete.

statuses.label: Optional
statuses.description: Nice-to-have game features that are not required for the current milestone.

nextSteps.label: Continue Development
nextSteps.description: Continue working with Game Dev agent

game-designer.whenToUse: At the start of a game project to define mechanics, create GDDs, and design game systems.
examplePrompts: Create a GDD for a 2D platformer
Design the combat mechanics for the RPG
Define the progression system for the puzzle game

game-architect.whenToUse: After game design to select engine (Unity, Unreal, Godot), design architecture, and create technical specs.
examplePrompts: Design the entity component system architecture
Select the best engine for our puzzle game
Create the networking architecture for multiplayer

game-scrum-master.whenToUse: During production to plan sprints, track progress, prepare stories, and run retrospectives.

game-dev.whenToUse: When game stories are ready for development, or when code needs review.
examplePrompts: Review the code changes for the inventory feature
Add unit tests for the combat module

game-solo-dev.whenToUse: For quick prototypes, rapid iteration, or when working solo without full planning overhead.
examplePrompts: Quick prototype the core gameplay loop
Create a playtest plan for the demo

game-qa.whenToUse: When setting up testing infrastructure, creating playtest plans, or validating game performance.
examplePrompts: Set up the game testing framework
Create a playtest plan for the demo level
Validate the performance on target hardware

analysis.label: Analysis
analysis.description: Brainstorm game ideas, define the creative vision, and develop narrative elements.

workflows.label: Brainstorm Game
workflows.tooltip: Interactive brainstorming session to explore game concepts, mechanics, art direction, and core gameplay loops. Produces a brainstorming report to guide game design decisions.

workflows.label: Create Game Brief
workflows.tooltip: Creates a game brief capturing the core concept, genre, target audience, unique selling points, and high-level design pillars. The foundation document for all game development.

workflows.label: Narrative
workflows.tooltip: Develops the game's narrative elements: world-building, character backgrounds, story arcs, dialogue systems, and lore. Creates a narrative document that informs level and quest design.

planning.label: Planning
planning.description: Create Game Design Documents, define gameplay systems, and plan development stories.

workflows.label: Create GDD
workflows.description: Create or update Game Design Document
workflows.tooltip: Creates a comprehensive Game Design Document (GDD) covering gameplay mechanics, systems design, progression, controls, and technical requirements. The primary reference for all game development work.

workflows.label: Create Story
workflows.tooltip: Creates an individual development story with detailed acceptance criteria, technical requirements, and implementation notes. Stories become the work items on your sprint board.

architecture.label: Architecture
architecture.description: Design game technical architecture, plan engine systems, and create component diagrams.

workflows.label: Game Architecture
workflows.tooltip: Designs the game's technical architecture: engine systems, rendering pipeline, physics, networking, asset pipeline, and component structure. Produces an architecture document guiding all implementation.

management.label: Management
management.description: Sprint planning, progress tracking, retrospectives, and project context generation.

workflows.label: Sprint Planning
workflows.tooltip: Helps prioritize stories, estimate effort, and organize the next sprint. Selects which backlog stories to move into the sprint based on capacity and dependencies.

workflows.label: Sprint Status
workflows.tooltip: Generates a progress report of the current sprint: which stories are in progress, completed, or blocked. Updates the sprint-status tracking file.

workflows.label: Retrospective
workflows.tooltip: Facilitates a sprint retrospective to review what went well, what didn't, and what to improve. Documents learnings and action items for the next sprint.

workflows.label: Correct Course
workflows.tooltip: When a story or implementation has gone off-track, this workflow helps diagnose the issue and plan corrections. Use when code review reveals problems or requirements have changed.

workflows.label: Generate Project Context
workflows.tooltip: Generates a comprehensive project context summary of all planning artifacts. AI agents use this during development to understand the full project scope.
